text: Rowing at the 1932 Summer Olympics featured seven events. The competitions were held from August 9 to August 13 at the Marine Stadium in Long Beach, California. ==Medal summary== {| |-valign="top" | single sculls | | | |-valign="top" |double sculls | | | |-valign="top" | coxless pair | | | |-valign="top" | coxed pair | Joseph Schauers Charles Kieffer Edward Jennings | Jerzy Braun Janusz Ślązak Jerzy Skolimowski | Anselme Brusa André Giriat Pierre Brunet |-valign="top" | coxless four | John Badcock Hugh Edwards Jack Beresford Rowland George | Karl Aletter Ernst Gaber Walter Flinsch Hans Maier | Antonio Ghiardello Francesco Cossu Giliante D'Este Antonio Garzoni Provenzani |-valign="top" | coxed four | Hans Eller Horst Hoeck Walter Meyer Joachim Spremberg Carlheinz Neumann | Bruno Vattovaz Giovanni Plazzer Riccardo Divora Bruno Parovel Giovanni Scher | Jerzy Braun Janusz Ślązak Stanisław Urban Edward Kobyliński Jerzy Skolimowski |-valign="top" | eight | Edwin Salisbury James Blair Duncan Gregg David Dunlap Burton Jastram Charles Chandler Harold Tower Winslow Hall Norris Graham | Vittorio Cioni Mario Balleri Renato Bracci Dino Barsotti Roberto Vestrini Guglielmo Del Bimbo Enrico Garzelli Renato Barbieri Cesare Milani | Earl Eastwood Joseph Harris Stanley Stanyar Harry Fry Cedric Liddell William Thoburn Don Boal Albert Taylor Les MacDonald |} ==Participating nations== A total of 152 rowers from 13 nations competed at the Los Angeles Games: * * * * * * * * * * * * * ==Medal table== ==References== ==External links== * International Olympic Committee medal database Category:1932 Summer Olympics events 1932 Category:1932 in sports in California Category:1932 in rowing
title: Rowing at the 1932 Summer Olympics
